item.title: All lights not working in arch under Southwark Bridge, 29th January
item.description:
These lights haven’t worked for over four weeks. It’s a public safety risk as there is crime in the area. It is a main route along the river at Bankside. The issue is in the arch under Southwark Bridge next to Zizzi Restaurant Bankside. Please fix ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Bridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New Tesco sign overhanging footway, 29th January
item.description:
A new sign has been installed on Rotherhithe Street overhanging the public highway. Regardless of whether or not planning was obtained, such an overhanging of the public highway should not be allowed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silver Walk, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: Dumped fridge freezer, 29th January
item.description:
This fridge freezer has obviously been dumped out in the walkway , it has been out in the street for a number of weeks , it has reached the stage where not only is it an eyesore, but it has become a hazard where it can be a safety issue , if it was to fall on a child or a child or an animal were to be stuck inside , the offending item can’t be missed as it is tall and white and out on the pavement so needs to be removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Walsingham Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 40 'No parking' cones have been placed along perfectly legal road to park, Scotts avenue and Scotts lane, 29th January
item.description:
Hi, About 40 'no parking' cones have been placed on the junction of Scotts lane and Scotts avenue which is preventing vehicles from parking in a perfectly legal place. I know there was an issue with this in October that you resolved. I would be grateful if you could look into this as it is the only place I can park close to my flat.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Scotts Lane, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
